Description: Basic principles and quantities that form the foundation of electrical engineering
Components that do not require external power to operate and cannot amplify signals.
Components that require external power and can control or amplify electrical signals.
Concepts: Diodes|Zener diodes|Transistors|Bipolar junction transistors|Field-effect transistors|Operational amplifiers|Semiconductor physics|P-N junctions|Saturation|Cutoff|Biasing

Description: Methods used to analyze and solve electrical circuits.
Concepts: Kirchhoff's Current Law|Kirchhoff's Voltage Law|Mesh analysis|Nodal analysis|Thevenin's theorem|Norton's theorem|Superposition theorem|Maximum power transfer theorem|Load line analysis|Linearity

Description: Concepts specific to alternating current (AC) circuits.
Concepts: Alternating current|RMS voltage|RMS current|Phasors|Reactance|Impedance|Frequency|Resonance|Bandwidth|Bode plots|Frequency response|Nyquist criterion|Phase-locked loops

Description: Study of circuit behavior during changes from one steady state to another.
Concepts: Transients in RC circuits|Transients in RL circuits|Transients in RLC circuits|Time constants|Steady-state analysis|Transient response

Description: Techniques and components for manipulating signal frequency and amplitude.
Concepts: Filters|Low-pass filters|High-pass filters|Band-pass filters|Band-stop filters|Active filters|Passive filters|Pulse-width modulation|Oscillators|Schmitt trigger circuits

Description: Circuits designed to increase the power, voltage, or current of a signal.
Concepts: Operational amplifiers|Inverting amplifier|Non-inverting amplifier|Summing amplifier|Differential amplifier|Common-emitter amplifier|Common-base amplifier|Common-collector amplifier|Gain|Small signal analysis|Differential pairs|Darlington pair|Cascaded amplifiers

Description: Conversion and control of electrical power using electronic devices.
Concepts: Rectification|Half-wave rectifier|Full-wave rectifier|Bridge rectifier|Voltage regulators|Switching circuits|Power factor|AC power|Complex power|Active power|Reactive power|Apparent power|Impedance matching

Description: Systems that manage, command, or regulate the behavior of other devices or systems.
Concepts: Feedback|Negative feedback|Positive feedback|Stability|Poles and zeros|Transfer function|Control systems|Nyquist criterion|Bode plots (also relevant here)|Phase margin|Gain margin
